issue.title: [R] Unable to Install on Manjaro Linux with gcc11
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13192](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13192). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13192?focusedCommentId=17370609) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
Hello, thank you for the very detailed report here, that really helps in figuring out what is going on.

Ultimately, it looks like the build process is failing while trying to install the AWS sdk dependency. I haven't seen this specific error in the past, but will try and get a docker container with this flavor of linux to re-create the issue.

In the mean time I did notice a few things that are a bit odd / might help with this:

- It looks like you're using an MRAN snapshot from back when Arrow 3.0.0 was the released version — we've since had one major and one minor release (we're at 4.0.1). I would recommend trying to install the latest version if possible. We have bumped the required version number for that AWS sdk (from 1.8.90 in 3.0.0 to 1.8.133 in 4.0.0). This bump might resolve the build issue in this one dependency.
  
  If that first suggestion doesn't improve things, there are a few other possibilities that might get you unblocked (with varying levels of complication):
- This particular dependency is only really necessary and will only be build if you enable the S3 features in Arrow. These are enabled by default when building with  `install_arrow()`. If you don't need to use S3 with arrow, you could try disabling those features:
  {code:r}
   Sys.setenv(
        ARROW_S3="OFF",
1. these below are what minimal=false turns on, but feel free to trun any of these compression or memory allocators off that you don't need or want to build.
         ARROW_JEMALLOC="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_BROTLI="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_BZ2="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_LZ4="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_SNAPPY="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_ZLIB="ON",
         ARROW_WITH_ZSTD="ON"
       )
       arrow::install_arrow(verbose = TRUE, minimal = TRUE)
   {code}
- Alternatively, you could try building + installing the AWS sdk manually and if that succeeds arrow will pick it up (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-cpp/v1/developer-guide/setup-linux.html has some more information about that). Thought note you'll need to get the sdk version that matches the requirements for arrow (AWS SDK 1.8.90 for 3.0.0 and 1.8.133 for 4.0.0 and 4.0.1).

When I went digging in their repo I came across [an issue with gcc11](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-cpp/issues/1635) which might be what's going on here. It looks like they already have (some of the necessary?) changes in place to resolve this (though we use a pinned version so we would need to upgrade to take advantage of that). What version of gcc are you using (you can tell which one with `$(R CMD config CXX11) --version`? If it's 11, is it possible to try downgrading your gcc to 9 or 10 and see if the problem persists?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13192?focusedCommentId=17375728) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
An update here: I've made ARROW-13241 to track bumping those aws SDK dependencies. As part of ARROW-13199 I've confirmed that arrow _does_ build on GCC 11 (so long as S3 support is turned off). Also as part of that ticket I updated the behavior so now one can set environment variables like `ARROW_S3=OFF LIBARROW_MINIMAL=FALSE` to get a maximal build, but with S3 still turned off. This should get you a working build of Arrow (albeit without S3 support). Would you mind confirming that that works?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13192?focusedCommentId=17377591) by Carlos Parada (ParadaCarleton):*
I believe I've figured out the source of the problem – the binaries on the official Arch repositories are out of date:

<https://archlinux.org/packages/community/x86_64/arrow/>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13192?focusedCommentId=17379192) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
Thanks for that extra info — I've created ARROW-13308 so that we can determine/work on how we want to support that. Archlinux isn't currently on [our list of officially supported distributions](https://arrow.apache.org/install/#c-and-glib-c-packages-for-debian-gnulinux-ubuntu-and-centos). 

The other tickets above address (or will address when resolved) the other things we ran into, so I'm going to close this ticket for now and keep progress tracked on those individual tickets. If I missed something please let me know.
